in 2010 waste heat will likely become formally recognized as a source of renewable power.
Today, the average efficiency of power plants in the US is only 30%, and nearly all of our waste heat goes unused.
The first power plant in the US, opened by Edison in 1882 at 255 Pearl in Manhattan, was 50% efficient, using waste heat to heat local homes
waste heat is an abundant, 100% clean energy source
